intro: Cyanea copelandii subsp. copelandii, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. It has narrow, strap-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
